item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.

item.title: Bling so big it gets it's own cozy. Kent Roadrunner Marathon medal and Buff. #racebling
item.description: Bling so big it gets it's own cozy. Kent Roadrunner Marathon medal and Buff. #racebling

item.title: Common tapering mistakes
item.description:
Common tapering mistakes

It might be one of the most feared words in a runner's vocabulary, right next to patience and rest. After months of long miles and lung-busting intervals, finding the right balance of sharpening and rest to hit race day firing on all cylinders can be a nerve-wracking process.

item.title: Official advice to eat low-fat diet is wrong, says health charity
item.description:
Official advice to eat low-fat diet is wrong, says health charity

Urging people to follow low-fat diets and to lower their cholesterol is having "disastrous health consequences", a health charity has warned. In a damning report that accuses major public health bodies of colluding with the food industry, the National Obesity Forum and the Public Health Collaboration call for a "major overhaul" of current dietary guidelines.

item.title: Tonbridge parkrun #129
item.description:
Tonbridge parkrun #129

One where I get to run by myself

item.title: Pre race preperation for Ocean Lake Tri clubs first Aquathlon of the year.
item.description:
Pre race preperation for Ocean Lake Tri clubs first Aquathlon of the year.

A great evening race at Leybourne Lakes. My first ever aquathlon! The race had two distances running simultaneously a 750m swim and a 1500m swim each followed by a 5k run. The two running together was slightly confusing and led to me going off far to fast on the swim. Got to about 25om metre and nearly died, slowed down a bit recovered and the second lap of the swim was much more comfortable with less people.

item.title: Parkrun celebrates million runner milestone - BBC News
item.description:
Parkrun celebrates million runner milestone - BBC News

Parkrun is celebrating a major milestone - more than a million people in the UK have now taken part in the free weekly 5km runs.

item.title: No title
One year since Park Run phenomenon took off
item.description:
One year since Park Run phenomenon took off

EVERY week hundreds of people dressed in T-shirts and trainers head out together, in Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells, united by one thing - a love for the open air and running. This is parkrun - not a stroll in the park - but more a gentle jog or even a sprint.

item.title: Swim to win
item.description:
Swim to win

First, a confession: my interest in swimming began after I read about Michael Phelps' diet. The decorated Olympic swimmer, I found out, consumes a whopping 12,000 calories a day, involving the chomping down of pizzas, pasta and eight-egg omelettes. If Phelpsy can eat all that and look completely ripped, maybe it's time the rest of us headed to the pool, hey?
